title: How Fury Over Israel’s Qatar Attack Pushed Netanyahu on Gaza
summary: Hamas has agreed to some elements of the proposal by President Trump to end the war in Gaza, but it’s not clear if its conditions ultimately would satisfy the White House or Israel.

title: Sean Combs Begged Judge for Mercy Before Sentencing
summary: “My domestic violence will always be a heavy burden that I will have to forever carry,” Mr. Combs said in a 12-minute presentation.

title: Trump Administration Is Said to Plan to Cut Refugee Admissions to a Record Low
summary: Many of the slots would go to white South Africans and others facing “unjust discrimination,” according to people familiar with the matter and documents obtained by The New York Times.

title: Supreme Court Lets Trump Revoke Deportation Protections for Venezuelans
summary: The Trump administration has tried to end deportation protections for more than 300,000 Venezuelan immigrants.

title: Why Are H-1B Visas Suddenly a Big Deal? One Reason: Tech Jobs Disappeared
summary: The president’s decision to charge employers $100,000 per visa for skilled workers seemed to come out of nowhere. But the grievance behind it has been simmering.

title: Judge Finds ‘Likelihood’ That Charges Against Abrego Garcia Are Vindictive
summary: The ruling was an astonishing rebuke of both the Justice Department and some of its top officials, including Todd Blanche, the deputy attorney general.

title: Trump Administration Can’t Decide Whether the Shutdown Is Bad or Good
summary: Is it “fun” and an “unprecedented opportunity,” or is it “madness” that must end? Depends who’s talking.

title: Marjorie Taylor Greene Criticizes Senate Republicans for Government Shutdown
summary: In a social media post, the far-right Georgia congresswoman called on Senate Republicans to eliminate the filibuster, lowering the threshold on future legislation to a simple majority.

title: Canada Will Headline the Pacific Airshow in California Because of the Shutdown
summary: The government shutdown has prevented a U.S. Air Force group and possibly a Navy squadron from attending signature air shows in California. Instead, a Canadian team is set to be the headliner.

title: Justice Kavanaugh’s Would-Be Assassin Sentenced to 8 Years in Prison
summary: Sophie Roske traveled from California to Maryland intending to kill Justice Brett Kavanaugh, then changed her mind and called 911.

title: A Japanese Ski Resort Town Is Roiled by a Debate Over Immigration
summary: Residents are protesting a planned housing facility for foreign workers, exposing the conflict between Japan’s need for labor and anxieties over immigration.

title: What to Know About Japan’s Leadership Election
summary: Japan’s beleaguered governing party will convene for a crucial election that could pave the way for the first female prime minister or the youngest leader in 140 years.

title: 2 Teen Girls Died In a Hit-And-Run. Another Teen Faces Murder Charges.
summary: The 17-year-old friends in a small New Jersey town were killed on their way to get ice cream. Prosecutors said the crash was intentional.

title: U.S. Research Focus in the Arctic Shifts: Less Climate, More Security
summary: The Trump administration is emphasizing defense concerns instead of climate research in the rapidly warming Arctic region.

title: Audio Clips of Sounds of Climate Changes
summary: For the Climate Forward live event, we gathered recordings of a melting glacier, the Amazon jungle and the underwater Arctic, all soundscapes that are rapidly changing.

title: Can This Isolated British Island Keep Its Economy Afloat?
summary: The Isle of Wight, known for its beaches and a rock festival that featured Jimi Hendrix and Bob Dylan, has had setbacks in manufacturing, but there have also been bright spots.

title: Indian Comedian Kunal Kamra Forced Offstage Amid Political Censorship
summary: The Indian comedian Kunal Kamra was forced offstage after a political joke led to a mob attack. Unlike Jimmy Kimmel, he is unlikely to return anytime soon.

title: Trump’s Boat Strike Cartel War Doesn’t Make a Lot of Sense So Far
summary: From what little we do know about the airstrikes in the Caribbean, the operation doesn’t make much sense.

title: Man Drives Car Onto Sidewalk Outside L.A. City Hall, Barricading Himself Inside
summary: A man in a vehicle displaying a handwritten sign referring to President Trump refused to exit his car as the authorities shut down surrounding streets. The man was taken into custody.

title: Journalists at 3 Alaska Newspapers Quit Over Charlie Kirk Story
summary: The publications in Alaska lost significant staffing after the owners made changes to an article that had drawn criticism from a Republican state lawmaker.

title: Arthur Jones, Former Baltimore Ravens Player, Dies at 39
summary: He played for the Ravens when the team won the Super Bowl in 2013.

title: Over $1 Million Bounty Is Found Off Florida Treasure Coast
summary: Treasure hunters found roughly 1,000 silver and gold coins off the east coast of Florida this summer. Many have visible dates and mint marks.
